gurmukhi: joaU swhs kY sB AwXuD ly sMig sXwm ky Awie kY nYk ArY ] iqh kau jdubIr iqhI iCn mY kib sXwm khY ibn pRwn krY ]1796]
transliteration: Jooo Saahas Kai Sabh Aayudh Le San(i) Syaam Ke Aae Kai Naikdarai|| Tih Kau Jadoubeer Tihichhin Mai Kabi Syaam Kahai Bin Praan Darai||1796||
translation: Any warrior who tries courageously to fight with Krishna even slightly, he is killed by Krishna in an instant.1796.

gurmukhi: jo Bt SsqR sMBwr sBY biRjnwiek pY Aiq AYfo su AwvY ] jo koaU dUr qy sXwm BnY Dnu qwn kY sXwm pY bwn clwvY ]
transliteration: Jo Bhat Shastra Sanbhaar Sbbai Brijnaaik Pai At(i) Aido Su Aavai Jo Ko( i)  Door Te Syaam Bhanai Dhan(u) Taan Kai Syaam Pai Baan Chalaavai||
translation: Any warrior, who taking up his weapons comes proudly in front of Krishna and discharges his arrows by pulling his bow from a distance,

gurmukhi: jo Air Awie skY nhI swmuhY dUr qy TwFyeI gwl bjwvY ] qwih kau sRI biRjnwQ icqY sr eyk hI so prlok pTwvY ]1797]
transliteration: Jo Ar(i) Aae Sakai Nahisaamuhai Door Te Thaadheigadl Bajaavai|| Taah(i) Kau Sribrijnaath Chitai Saar Ek Hiso Parlok Pathaavai||1797||
translation: And talks contemptuously and does not come near him, Krishna seeing him with his far-off sight, is sending him to the next world with a single arrow..1797.

gurmukhi: dyK dSw iqn kI bfyeI bIr S`qRn ky rwm BnY AYsI BwNiq icq mY irswq hY ] lIny krvwr mwr mwr hI aucwr smuhwie Awie sXwmjU so ju`Du hI mcwq hY ]
transliteration: Dekh Dashaa Tin Kibadeibeer Shattran Ke Raam Bhanai Aisibhaant(i) Chit Mai Risaat Hai|| Leene Karvaar Maar Maar Hiouchaar Samuhaae Aae Syaamjoo So Juddh(u) Himachaat Hai||
translation: Seeing them in such a plight, the great warriors on the enemy’s side, are getting furious; they, in fury, shouting “kill, kill”, are fighting with Krishna;

gurmukhi: eyk injkwq nhI mn mY frwq muskwq Gwie Kwq mwno sBY eyk jwq hY ] gwlih bjwq eyk hrK bFwq CqR Drm krwq qy vy surg isDwq hY ]1798]
transliteration: Ek Nijkaat Ek Jaat Hai|| Gadlah(i) Bajaat Ek Harakh Badhaat Chhatra Dharam Karaat Ve Surag Sidhaat Hai||1798||
translation: Many of them, in fear, are not coming near and are receiving wounds smilingly from a distance; many of them are playing on their cheeks from a distance, but several of them, following the duties of Kshatriyas, are leaving for heaven.1798.

gurmukhi: biRjnwiek ky bl lwiek jy kib sXwm khY soaU swmuih AwvY ] bwn kmwn kiRpwn gdw gih kRu`D Bry Aiq ju`D mcwvY ]
transliteration: Brijnaaeeik Ke Bal Laaik Je Kabi Syaam Kahai Sooo Saamuh(i) Aavai|| Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadaa Gadh Kruddh Bhare At(i) Juddh Machaavai||
translation: Those who are capable of fighting with Krishna, they are coming before him and catching hold of bow, arrows, swords, maces etc., they are waging a dreadful war;

gurmukhi: eyk pry ibnu pRwn Drw iek sIs kty rn BUmih DwvY ] eykn kI br loQ prI kr so gih kY Air Er clwvY ]1799]
transliteration: Ek Dare Bin(u) Praan Dharaa Ik Sees Kate Ran Bhaamah(i) Dhaavai|| Ekan Kibar Loth Pariloth Parikar Se Gadh Kai Ar(i) Or Chalaavai||1799||
translation: Someone becoming lifeless is falling on the ground and someone is roaming in the battlefield, though his head has been chopped; someone catching the lying corpses, is throwing it towards the enemy.1799.

gurmukhi: sUr su eyk hnY qh bwj qhw iek bIr bfy gj mwrY ] eyk rQI blvwn hnY iek pwiek mwr kY bIr pCwrY ]
transliteration: Soor Su Ek Hanai Tah Baaj Ik Beer Bade Gad Mdarai|| Ek Rathibalvaan Hanai Ik Paaik Maar Kai Beer Pachhdarai||
translation: The warriors have killed horses, elephants and warriors; many powerful chariot-riders and soldiers on foot have been killed;

gurmukhi: eyk Bjy liK Awhv kau iek Gwiel Gwiel ko llkwrY ] eyk lrY n frY Gn sXwm ko Dwie kiRpwn ky Gwie pHwrY ]1800]
transliteration: Ek Bhaje Lakh(i) Aahav Kau Ik Ghaail Ghaail Ko Lalkdarai|| Ek Darai Na Darai Ghan Syaam Ko Dhaae Kridaan Ke Ghaae Prahdarai||1800||
translation: Many of them have fled away, seeing the ferocity of war; many of the wounded are challenging the wounded ones; many are fighting fearlessly and running here and there, are striking blows with their swords.1800.

gurmukhi: Gyr lIE chU Er hir bIrin SsqR sMBwr ] bwr Kyq ijau Cwp ng riv sis ijau prvwr ]1801]
transliteration: Gher Leeo Chahoo Or Har(i) Bderan(i) Shastra Sanbhaar|| Baar Khet Jio Chhaad Nag Rav(i) Sas(i) Jio Parvaar||1801||
translation: The warriors holding their weapons, have surrounded Krishna from all the four sides like the fence surrounding the field, the ring surrounding the studded precious stone and the sphere (halo) of sun and moon surrounding the sun and moon.1801.
